intro: Chrysocoma gigantea, commonly known as the giant chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland forested areas.
